page.title: 11LAND USE
page.content: The 12 farms in the study area cover a total of 1985 acres. The size of farm ranges from 65 to 410 acres with an average of 165 acres. Of this total, 482 acres were left as permanent or rough pasture, 1185 acres were classified as improved pasture and 278 acres as arable. There were 1178 cows, the majority grazing on the flatter land in the west of the area. Sheep were mainly located on the steeper, poorer quality land towards the east where one farm owned 2325 of the 3614 total for the area. One farm had 12 horses. The farms had a total of 30 tractors, but only 2 combines as most of the limited amount of cereal harvesting is done by contractors. Nine farms had their own haymaking equipment.
